results.title: Thailand for sale
results.creator_credit: Small World Productions, CTE and David Jay
results.brief_description: Annually, Thailand reaps a financial reward from thousands of tourists. However, the tourism boom has had a destructive effect upon the Thai people, flora and fauna. In an effort to capture the tourist dollar, luxury resorts have been built with no regard for the lives of local inhabitants. This program looks at Phuket and its problems from a local perspective, investigating the reality behind the paradise illusion.

results.title: Thailand - do good receive good, do evil receive evil
results.creator_credit: John Temple, Arch Nicholson, University of Queensland Press, Film Australia and ABC
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Asian insight”.
A look at the historical and cultural background of Thailand - this film attempts to address racist preconceptions about Thai people and their beliefs and rituals. Concentrates on two elements that affect all Thais: Buddhism and the role of the monarchy. It points out how the Monks appear to be losing their leadership roles as Thai society becomes more urbanised and how the Government is attempting to inform the Monks about social change so they don’t lose their place in society. Includes one or two scenes of violence (burning bodies, slaughter etc.) from newsreels. Presented by John Temple.

results.title: Thailand's streams of life
results.creator_credit: United Nations. Film Board and United Nations. Dept. of Public Information
results.brief_description: The broad and busy rivers of Thailand are her life blood. In the development of river communications, of irrigation schemes, and of fishing. Thailand works closely with the UN. The efficiently organised river traffic has provided a model for UN technical assistance advisers; loans from the International Bank help the advancement of irrigation and flood control project; and a Food and Agriculture Organisation Commission cooperates with local experts in fishery research.

results.title: Thailand
results.creator_credit: Roan Hannam, Don Murray, John Temple, Arch Nicholson, University of Queensland, Film Australia and ABC
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Asian insight”
A look at the historical and cultural background of Thailand. Focuses on the respect the Thais have for the monks and their religion, and the veneration of the monarchy.

results.title: Thailand
results.creator_credit: Richard Carey, David Roberts, Nihon Hoso Kyokai, Maryland Public Television and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Mini dragons. II”.
In Thailand sudden economic success has created violence in the streets as a prosperous new middle-class demands democratic reform. Success, however, comes at a heavy price - pollution, an ever-increasing gap between rich and poor, uncontrolled development and destruction of the rainforest. Interviews four individuals who represent different aspects of Thailand’s success. A young ethnic Chinese millionairess who builds shopping malls, the Governor of the city of Bangkok, who is trying to solve its horrendous overcrowding problems, a couple of rural peasants forced to work in Bangkok to provide for their son’s education and an activist Buddhist monk trying to save the rainforest.

results.title: Thai Airways fly 748
results.creator_credit: Technical and Scientific Films, British Information Services and Paul Cullerne
results.brief_description: The British Hawker 748 seen in daily scheduled operation with Thai Airways against the spectacular scenery and colourful background of Thailand. The aircraft are seen in service on Thailand’s internal routes and in production at Manchester. Features of the aircraft are explained and its ease of servicing illustrated.

results.title: Tgv, Ariane
results.brief_description:
The first segment explores the Ariane launching centre in Kourou (Fr. Guyanna). The second segment takes us on board a high-speed train on the day a speed record of 380 km/h is established.

Credits: No credits available.

results.title: Textures
results.brief_description: Explores the factors which influence our impression of texture: light, point of view and function. Visual examples range from Henry Moore’s sculptures to simple kitchen utensils. Combines a sensitive use of close-up photography with a percussion score by Herb Harris. No other credtits available.

results.title: Texture in painting
results.brief_description: Demonstrates the significance of texture in painting and in everyday life. Painters Phoebe Flory and Eliot O’Hara explain the thinking behind the use of textures, with illustrative examples that span the history of art from the Ming Dynasty to today’s non-objective painters.
